snippet.title: WHO: H7N9 virus 'one of the most lethal so far'
snippet.description:
* As the death toll from China's bird flu outbreak rose to 22 with news of another victim in eastern Zhejiang Province, the World Health Organization warned the H7N9 virus was one of the most lethal that doctors and medical investigators had faced in...
http://news.blogs.cnn.com/2013/04/24/who-h7n9-virus-one-of-the-most-lethal-so-far/

snippet.title: WHO: H7N9 virus 'one of the most lethal so far'
snippet.description:
* On the same day yet another death was reported in China's bird flu outbreak, the World Health Organization warned the H7N9 virus was one of the most lethal that doctors and medical investigators had faced in recent years.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/24/world/asia/china-birdflu/index.html

snippet.title: China bird flu cases now at 102
snippet.description:
* The number of bird flu cases in China jumped Sunday to 102, including 20 deaths, the World Health Organization announced.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/21/world/asia/china-bird-flu/index.html

snippet.title: Chicken still on menu, WHO tells China as bird flu spreads
snippet.description:
* The World Health Organization announced the launch of an international investigation into a new deadly strain of bird flu, as the total number of infections in China rose to 87.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/19/world/asia/china-bird-flu/index.html

snippet.title: China bird flu case count rises to 83
snippet.description:
* Another case of bird flu has been reported in China, taking the total infection count to 83 people, as health authorities inside and outside the country try to determine how to stop its spread.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/18/world/asia/china-bird-flu/index.html

snippet.title: New bird flu well-adapted to infect people
snippet.description:
* A new variation of bird flu that the WHO says has caused at least 11 deaths in China has genetic characteristics that make it well-adapted to infect people.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/12/health/bird-flu/index.html

snippet.title: Nine dead in China bird flu outbreak, officials probe family 'clusters'
snippet.description:
* Two more people have died from a rare strain of bird flu in China, as health officials investigate possible cases of transmission between family members.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/10/world/asia/china-bird-flu-death-toll/index.html

snippet.title: China bird flu crisis claims new victims as death toll rises to 9
snippet.description:
* China's bird flu crisis showed no sign of easing Tuesday as the death toll rose to nine, a government agency said.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/09/world/asia/china-bird-flu-death/index.html

snippet.title: China bird flu cases rise, still no evidence of human transmission
snippet.description:
* China announced another case of a rare strain of bird flu Monday, taking the total number of H7N9 infections to 21, the state-run Xinhua news agency said.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/04/08/world/asia/china-bird-flu-who/index.html

snippet.title: China's bird flu mystery
snippet.description:
* By Laurie Garrett, Special to CNN Editor's note: Laurie Garrett is a Pulitzer prize-winning journalist and senior fellow for global health and the Council on Foreign Relations. The views expressed are her own. This week, millions of Chinese visited...
http://globalpublicsquare.blogs.cnn.com/2013/04/06/chinas-bird-flu-mystery/
